name: IoT Central Solution Builder ADX OEE Configuration

deploymentConfigs.name: Create Resource Group
deploymentConfigs.description: The owning resource group for the Azure resources that will be provisioned below.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create IoT Central application
deploymentConfigs.description: An Azure IoT Central application instance. This will ingest telemetry from the opc-plc simulator module and export the data via continuous data export (CDE) to an Azur Data Explorer instance.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create gateway device capability model
deploymentConfigs.description: Create the edge device capability model including the IoT Edge runtime deployment manifest

extends.displayName: Manufacturing In A Box Gateway Device Interface
extends.name: com_azureiot_miabgateway_miabgateway_device_interface

extends.displayName: Manufacturing In A Box Gateway Module Interface
extends.name: com_azureiot_miabgateway_ModuleInterface

deploymentConfigs.name: Register gateway edge device
deploymentConfigs.description: Register a new edge device to be used as the IoT Edge runtime device

deploymentConfigs.name: Get gateway device attestation properties
deploymentConfigs.description: Get the scope id and device provisioning key for the registered edge device. These values will be used to provision the IoT Edge runtime.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create Azure VM with IoT Edge Runtime
deploymentConfigs.description: An Azure ARM template to deploy a virtual machine with the Opc Plc simulator.

metadata.description: Unique DNS Name for the Storage Account where the Virtual Machine's disks will be placed.
User name for the Virtual Machine.
IoT Central Edge Device Provisioning Key
Allow SSH traffic through the firewall
SSH Key or password for the Virtual Machine. SSH key is recommended.
The Ubuntu version for the VM. This will pick a fully patched image of this given Ubuntu version.
Type of authentication to use on the Virtual Machine. SSH key is recommended.

resources.comments: Default Network Security Group for template
resources.name: [variables('networkSecurityGroupName')]

osProfile.customData:
[base64(concat('#cloud-config

apt:
  preserve_sources_list: true
  sources:
    msft.list:
      source: "deb https://packages.microsoft.com/ubuntu/20.04/prod focal main"
      key: |
        -----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----
        Version: GnuPG v1.4.7 (GNU/Linux)

        mQENBFYxWIwBCADAKoZhZlJxGNGWzqV+1OG1xiQeoowKhssGAKvd+buXCGISZJwT
        LXZqIcIiLP7pqdcZWtE9bSc7yBY2MalDp9Liu0KekywQ6VVX1T72NPf5Ev6x6DLV
        7aVWsCzUAF+eb7DC9fPuFLEdxmOEYoPjzrQ7cCnSV4JQxAqhU4T6OjbvRazGl3ag
        OeizPXmRljMtUUttHQZnRhtlzkmwIrUivbfFPD+fEoHJ1+uIdfOzZX8/oKHKLe2j
        H632kvsNzJFlROVvGLYAk2WRcLu+RjjggixhwiB+Mu/A8Tf4V6b+YppS44q8EvVr
        M+QvY7LNSOffSO6Slsy9oisGTdfE39nC7pVRABEBAAG0N01pY3Jvc29mdCAoUmVs
        ZWFzZSBzaWduaW5nKSA8Z3Bnc2VjdXJpdHlAbWljcm9zb2Z0LmNvbT6JATUEEwEC
        AB8FAlYxWIwCGwMGCwkIBwMCBBUCCAMDFgIBAh4BAheAAAoJEOs+lK2+EinPGpsH
        /32vKy29Hg51H9dfFJMx0/a/F+5vKeCeVqimvyTM04C+XENNuSbYZ3eRPHGHFLqe
        MNGxsfb7C7ZxEeW7J/vSzRgHxm7ZvESisUYRFq2sgkJ+HFERNrqfci45bdhmrUsy
        7SWw9ybxdFOkuQoyKD3tBmiGfONQMlBaOMWdAsic965rvJsd5zYaZZFI1UwTkFXV
        KJt3bp3Ngn1vEYXwijGTa+FXz6GLHueJwF0I7ug34DgUkAFvAs8Hacr2DRYxL5RJ
        XdNgj4Jd2/g6T9InmWT0hASljur+dJnzNiNCkbn9KbX7J/qK1IbR8y560yRmFsU+
        NdCFTW7wY0Fb1fWJ+/KTsC4=
        =J6gs
        -----END PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK----- 
packages:
  - moby-cli
  - moby-engine
runcmd:
  - sid="', variables('sid'),'"
  - did="', variables('did'),'"
  - sky="', variables('sky'),'"
  - |
      set -x
      (

        # Wait for docker daemon to start
        while [ $(ps -ef | grep -v grep | grep docker | wc -l) -le 0 ]; do 
          sleep 3
        done

        apt install -y aziot-edge

        if [ ! -z "$sid" ] && [ ! -z "$did" ] && [ ! -z "$sky" ]; then
          mkdir /etc/aziot
          wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Azure-Samples/iotc-solution-builder/main/iotedgeDeploy/config.toml -O /etc/aziot/config.toml
          sed -i "s#\(id_scope = \).*#\1\"$sid\"#g;s#\(registration_id = \).*#\1\"$did\"#g;s#\(value = \).*#\1\"$sky\" }#g" /etc/aziot/config.toml
          iotedge config apply -c /etc/aziot/config.toml
        fi

      ) &
'))]

deploymentConfigs.name: Register OPCUA downstream device
deploymentConfigs.description: Register an IoT Central OPCUA device to use to send telemetry from the OPCUA endpoint on the edge.

deploymentConfigs.name: Get OPCUA device attestation properties
deploymentConfigs.description: Get the scope id and device provisioning key for the registered OPCUA device. These values will be used to provision the device that subscribes to the OPCUA data.

deploymentConfigs.name: Provision OPCUA downstream device
deploymentConfigs.description: Provision the OPCUA device and subscribe to OPCUA data to send as telemetry.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create ADX cluster
deploymentConfigs.description: An Azure Data Explorer (ADX) instance to host and manipulate data exported from the Azure IoT Central instance. This resource will calculate business insights such as overall equipment effeciveness (OEE) and operational efficiency.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create ADX database
deploymentConfigs.description: Create a database in the newly created ADX cluster

deploymentConfigs.name: Add Service Principal
deploymentConfigs.description: Add the IoT Central Service Principal to the database with the role to ingest data to any table.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create ADX raw data table
deploymentConfigs.description: Create the ADX table that will hold the raw opcua data exported from IoT Central.

data.csl: .create table ${rawDataTableName} (applicationId:string, deviceId:string, deviceName:string, templateName:string, enqueuedTime:datetime, telemetry:dynamic)

deploymentConfigs.name: Enable streaming ingestion
deploymentConfigs.description: Enable streaming ingestion on the raw data table.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create device data table
deploymentConfigs.description: Create the ADX table to hold the transformed raw data that represents opc data from the device.

data.csl: .create table ${deviceDataTableName} (deviceId:string, deviceName:string, enqueuedTime:datetime, sourceTimestamp:datetime, dataSetWriterId:string, messageId:long, tag:string, value:real)

deploymentConfigs.name: Create ADX table update function
deploymentConfigs.description: Create a function that will transform data from the raw data table to the basic device data table.

data.csl: .create-or-alter function with (docstring = 'basic device opc data update policy', folder = 'opcfunctions') ${updateFunctionName} { ${rawDataTableName} | where telemetry.Messages has 'payload' | mv-expand telemetry.Messages | project deviceId, deviceName, enqueuedTime, messageId=telemetry.MessageId, dataSetWriterId=telemetry_Messages.DataSetWriterId, data=telemetry_Messages.Payload | mv-expand data | extend nodeId = tostring(bag_keys(data)[0]) | extend value= toreal(data[nodeId].Value) | extend sourceTimestamp = todatetime(data[nodeId].SourceTimestamp) | extend messageId = tolong(messageId) | extend dataSetWriterId = tostring(dataSetWriterId) | extend tag=tostring(split(nodeId, 's=')[1]) | project deviceId, deviceName, enqueuedTime, sourceTimestamp, dataSetWriterId, messageId, tag, value }

deploymentConfigs.name: Alter device table update policy
deploymentConfigs.description: Set update policy on raw data table to execute update function to transform data into device table.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create IoT Central export destination
deploymentConfigs.description: Create IoT Central data export destination configured for the Azure Data Explore database table.

deploymentConfigs.name: Create IoT Central export
deploymentConfigs.description: Create IoT Central data export definition configured for the Azure Data Explore database table.

destinations.transform:
{
    applicationId: .applicationId,
    deviceId: .device.id,
    deviceName: .device.name,
    templateName: .device.templateName,
    enqueuedTime: .enqueuedTime,
    telemetry: .telemetry | map({ key: .name, value: .value }) | from_entries,
 }
